title: result logging confusion

labels.name: topic: logging
labels.description: related with the logging aspect of Talos

body:
- [x] I'm up-to-date with the latest release (i.e. v.0.4.9 and all upcoming possibly):
- [x] I've confirmed that my Keras model works outside of Talos.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

I found a crucial issue in the result logging (**i.e. `results.py` for all current an upcoming versions**). All results, as well as the headers are stored in a single list, which is the member object `self.result`, or temporary variable `_rr_out` respectively. However, to store the values, the dictionary keys are traversed and concatenated into the list. **And here comes the issue**: Python does not guarantee the order of keys in a dictionary! Therefore, it is possible that values like `acc` may become `acc_val`, or the `loss` value becomes a parameter, and so on.

It might be the case that this issue hardly happens for only a few metrics and parameters. But it definitely happens in my exhaustive evaluations with dozens of metrics and parameters.

However, this issue can be very easily fixed by using a dictionary instead of a list for storing the results. I already implemented this feature in my fork: https://github.com/tik0/talos/commit/8db906f0ca8498de963b0e3c787e58a721e9e395
(Please notice that this commit is a forked branch, which comes with disabled stringification (#271), user defined history (#272) and fixed entropy (#268))

This is a major issue from my point of view and I will elaborate on a patch for a PR if desired.
